record.description: [Photographic copy of a drawing of the] High Energy Physics Building at Argonne National Laboratory. The building will serve as a center for high-energy physics research and will house personnel of Argonne's High Energy Physics Division as well as some 135 visiting university professors and students. The structure is expected to be completed by August 1963 at a cost of $6,900,000. The center is under construction at the site of the Zero Gradient Proton Synchrotron (ZGS) particle accelerator, a 12.5 billion electron volt atom smasher.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
